quiz.instructions: Choose the best answer for each question.

questions.question: What should a comprehensive trading plan include?
options: Goals, risk tolerance, strategies, entry/exit criteria, position sizing rules, and markets to trade
Only the stocks you want to buy
questions.explanation: A comprehensive trading plan should outline your goals, risk tolerance, strategies, entry and exit criteria, position sizing rules, and what markets or assets you'll trade.

questions.question: What should you record in a trading journal besides technical details?
options: Your emotional state, thoughts, and whether you followed your plan
questions.explanation: After every trade, record not just technical details but also your emotional state, what you were thinking, and whether you followed your plan to identify patterns over time.

questions.question: What is overconfidence bias?
options: Believing you're better than you actually are after a winning streak
questions.explanation: Overconfidence bias makes you believe you're better than you actually are after a winning streak, leading to excessive risk-taking.

questions.question: What is recency bias?
options: Giving too much weight to recent events
questions.explanation: Recency bias causes you to give too much weight to recent eventsâ€”if the last three trades were losers, you might avoid a great setup, or if they were winners, you might think you can't lose.

questions.question: What is the disposition effect?
options: Selling winners too quickly and holding losers too long
questions.explanation: The disposition effect causes traders to sell winners too quickly (to lock in the good feeling) and hold losers too long (to avoid the pain of admitting defeat).

questions.question: If you tend to revenge trade, what environmental control is suggested?
options: Trade more to get over it
Implement a waiting period of 30 minutes to an hour after closing a position
questions.explanation: If you revenge trade, implement a rule that you must wait thirty minutes or an hour after closing a position before opening a new one.

questions.question: Why is having a life outside of trading important?
options: It wastes time that could be spent trading
It helps maintain perspective and reduces the psychological weight of any single trade
It's not important for successful trading
It only matters for professional traders
questions.explanation: Having relationships, hobbies, and interests outside trading helps maintain perspective and reduces the psychological weight of any single trade.

questions.question: What should you accept to remove tremendous psychological pressure?
options: That perfection is impossible and losses are inevitable
That you should never make mistakes
questions.explanation: Accepting that perfection is impossible and losses are inevitable removes tremendous psychological pressure. You just need to be slightly more right than wrong over time with proper risk management.

questions.question: What is the purpose of accountability partners in trading?
options: To consult before placing trades, especially larger ones
questions.explanation: Some traders have accountability partners who they must consult before placing trades, especially larger ones, to provide objective perspective.

questions.question: When should you refer back to your trading plan?
options: When emotions run high during a trade
Only at the end of each month
questions.explanation: When emotions run high during a trade, you can refer back to your plan written during a calm, rational moment for guidance.
